definition: elegant name/honorific
elegant
to fit/balanced/suitable
to weigh/to state/to name/name/appellation/to praise
variant of 秤[cheng4]/steelyard

sentences.english: Is there a name for Asian women who like white guys?
sentences.chinese: 對喜歡白人男性的亞裔女性有沒有什麼雅稱？

sentences.english: Italian Sausage elegantly called "Salami", the shape of long thick rounded rolling pin.
sentences.chinese: 意大利肉腸雅稱“莎樂美”，形似粗長滾圓的擀麪杖。

sentences.english: The Name of the Ku Jie Jun appears in the Ming Dynasty, is the bamboo tea stove's elegant name.
sentences.chinese: 苦節君之名出現於明代，系竹茶爐的雅稱。

sentences.english: Foliage is frog skin shape the white sands, commonly known as "toad back".
sentences.chinese: 葉面呈蛙皮狀沙粒白點，雅稱“蝦蟆背”。

sentences.english: Correspondence is one kind of elegant name being the ancients to the letter.
sentences.chinese: 尺牘，是古人對書信的一種雅稱。

sentences.english: This elegant name comes from a legend.
sentences.chinese: 這道湯的雅稱來源於一個傳說故事。

definition: root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
sky clears after rain/new hopes after a disastrous period (idiom)/every cloud has a silver lining (idiom)/see also 雨過天晴|雨过天晴[yu3 guo4 tian1 qing2]
birds
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
tuning/temperament
Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
clear as ice and clean as jade (idiom); spotless/irreproachable/incorruptible
comfort and leisure

lit. three humble visits to a thatched cottage/cf famous episode in the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义 in which Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 recruits Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮 (the Hidden Dragon 臥龍|卧龙) to his cause by visiting him three times
lit. the duck is the first to know if the spring water is warm (idiom)/fig. an expert in the field knows which way the wind blows
pinyin: chun1 jiang1 shui3 nuan3 ya1 xian1 zhi1

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
fairyland/honorific: your homeland
mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
